org.hyperic.hq.hqapi1
Class AlertApi

java.lang.Object
  org.hyperic.hq.hqapi1.AlertApi

public class AlertApi
extends java.lang.Object

The Hyperic HQ Alert API.

This class provides access to the alerts within the HQ system. Each of the methods in this class return Response objects that wrap the result of the method with a ResponseStatus and a ServiceError that indicates the error if the response status is ResponseStatus.FAILURE.

getAlert

public AlertResponse getAlert(java.lang.Integer alertId)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Get an Alert

Parameters:
alertId - The id of the Alert to get.
Returns:
On ResponseStatus.SUCCESS, the Alert requested
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a network error occurs while making the request.

findAlerts

public AlertsResponse findAlerts(long begin,
                                 long end,
                                 int count,
                                 int severity,
                                 java.lang.Boolean inEscalation,
                                 java.lang.Boolean notFixed)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Find Alerts in the system.

Parameters:
begin - The beginning of the time window in epoch-millis.
end - The end of the time window in epoch-millis.
count - The maximum number of Alert instances to return.
severity - The minimum severity to query. 1 = LOW, 2 = MEDIUM, 3 = HIGH
inEscalation - If true, only return Alerts which are in Escalation
notFixed - If true, only return Alerts which are not fixed.
Returns:
On ResponseStatus.SUCCESS, a list of Alerts are returned via AlertsResponse.getAlert().
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a network error occurs while making the request.

findAlerts

public AlertsResponse findAlerts(long begin,
                                 long end,
                                 int count,
                                 int severity,
                                 java.lang.Boolean inEscalation,
                                 java.lang.Boolean notFixed,
                                 java.lang.Integer groupId)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Find Alerts in the system.

Parameters:
begin - The beginning of the time window in epoch-millis.
end - The end of the time window in epoch-millis.
count - The maximum number of Alert instances to return.
severity - The minimum severity to query. 1 = LOW, 2 = MEDIUM, 3 = HIGH
inEscalation - If true, only return Alerts which are in Escalation
notFixed - If true, only return Alerts which are not fixed.
groupId - Only return Alerts for resources within the given Group.
Returns:
On ResponseStatus.SUCCESS, a list of Alerts are returned via AlertsResponse.getAlert().
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a network error occurs while making the request.

                                 java.lang.Boolean notFixed)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Find Alerts for the given Resource.

Parameters:
r - The Resource to query for alerts.
begin - The beginning of the time window in epoch-millis.
end - The end of the time window in epoch-millis.
count - The maximum number of Alert instances to return.
severity - The minimum severity to query. 1 = LOW, 2 = MEDIUM, 3 = HIGH
inEscalation - If true, only return Alerts which are in Escalation
notFixed - If true, only return Alerts which are not fixed.
Returns:
On ResponseStatus.SUCCESS, a list of Alerts are returned via AlertsResponse.getAlert().

java.io.IOException - If a network error occurs while making the request.

                       throws java.io.IOException
Acknowledge an Alert

Parameters:
alertId - The id of the Alert to acknowledge.
reason - The reason for acknowledgement.
pause - If not null, pause the Escalation for the specified number of milliseconds.
Returns:
ResponseStatus.SUCCESS, if the Alert was successfully acknowledged.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a network error occurs while making the request.
